description: Number of non-unitary square divisors of n!.
formula: a(n)=A046951(n!)-2^r, where r is the number of prime divisors of unitary analog of largest square divisor of n!. r(n)=A001221[A000188(n!)/A055229(n!)]
example: n=10 and the largest square-root divisor of 10! is 720. 10! has 30 square divisors, of which 22 is not unitary [but squares]: {4,9,16,36,64,100,144,225,324,400,576,...,57600,129600}. E.g. GCD[576,10!/576]=GCD[576,6300]=36. Thus a(10)=30-8=22.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Aug 08 2000
